hero.title: Discover Koshi Pradesh
hero.subtitle: Explore the natural beauty, rich culture, and adventure opportunities in Nepal's eastern province

dharan.name: Dharan
dharan.description: A beautiful city at the foothills of the Himalayas
dharan.intro: Dharan is a sub-metropolitan city in Sunsari district, known for its pleasant climate and cultural diversity.
dharan.howToReach: Accessible by road from Kathmandu (6-7 hours) or by air to Biratnagar (45 minutes from Dharan).
dharan.culture: A melting pot of different ethnic communities with diverse traditions and festivals.
dharan.food: Famous for traditional Nepali dal-bhat, local fish curry, and various ethnic cuisines.
dharan.hiddenDestinations: Namaste Falls, Pindeshwar Temple, Buddha Subba Temple

ilam.name: Ilam
ilam.description: Famous for its tea gardens and scenic beauty
ilam.intro: Ilam is renowned for its tea plantations, rolling hills, and cool climate.
ilam.howToReach: Road journey from Kathmandu (12-14 hours) or flight to Bhadrapur (2 hours drive).
ilam.culture: Rich Nepali hill culture with traditional farming practices and warm hospitality.
ilam.food: Fresh tea, organic vegetables, traditional Nepali cuisine, and dairy products.
ilam.hiddenDestinations: Antu Danda, Mai Pokhari, Sandakphu viewpoint

koshiTappu.name: Koshi Tappu
koshiTappu.description: Wildlife reserve famous for bird watching
koshiTappu.intro: Koshi Tappu Wildlife Reserve is a wetland sanctuary and bird watcher's paradise.
koshiTappu.howToReach: Drive from Kathmandu (5-6 hours) via East-West Highway.
koshiTappu.culture: Local Tharu and other ethnic communities with unique wetland culture.
koshiTappu.food: Fresh fish from Koshi River, traditional Tharu cuisine, and organic rice.
koshiTappu.hiddenDestinations: Koshi Barrage, Bird watching towers, Traditional Tharu villages

festivals.title: Festivals & Events
festivals.dashain: Dashain - The biggest Hindu festival celebrated with family gatherings
festivals.tihar: Tihar - Festival of lights with traditional decorations
festivals.teej: Teej - Women's festival celebrated with fasting and dancing
